PrivacyViolationsSection.title: Why you need a private Proton alternative?
PrivacyViolationsSection.description: Get built-in zero-knowledge encryption with Internxt and full device protection

descriptions: Internxt offers Antivirus and Cleaner to keep your device free from malware and optimize performance. These essential security features are not currently available with a Proton account.
Proton Drive offers a maximum of 500GB for personal use. This is limited for large projects or media libraries compared to Internxtâ€™s plans that go up to 5TB.
Proton Drive has yet to implement post-quantum encryption. Without PQE, user data might not stay safe forever as quantum computing evolves to break standard algorithms.
Proton Drive lacks native Linux support. Internxt provides full support for Linux, WebDAV, Rclone, and NAS, offering more flexibility for advanced users.

WhyNeedAlternativeSection.title: Alternative to Proton
WhyNeedAlternativeSection.description: Find out why you need an alternative to Proton Drive and get a full privacy-first ecosystem.

descriptions: Internxt is the first cloud storage with post-quantum encryption. Proton Drive still uses standard encryption, which may become vulnerable to quantum computers.
Internxt goes beyond cloud storage with Antivirus and Cleaner, offering everything you need to keep your files and devices safe and private.
Internxt lifetime plans remove recurring fees. Pay once and get long-term access with predictable costs, an option Proton Drive does not offer.

VersusSection.title: Internxt vs Proton
VersusSection.description: Internxt offers unrivaled privacy and security thanks to zero-knowledge, post-quantum encryption and more flexible storage options.

competitorTable.title: Proton Drive: What about your privacy?

freePlanCard.description: Get 1GB of encrypted cloud storage for free

faq.question: Is Internxt a more secure and private alternative to Proton Drive?
answer: Yes, Internxt uses post-quantum and zero-knowledge encryption. Proton Drive manages the encryption keys on its own servers, which theoretically allows potential access to files under specific legal requests.
Additional features such as Antivirus, Device Cleaner, and Dark Web Monitor offer protection not available with Proton Drive.

faq.question: What is post-quantum encryption, and is it more secure?
answer: Unlike standard encryption used by Proton Drive, PQE algorithms are built to resist powerful quantum attacks, ensuring your data stays safe for the future.
This method is available for all Internxt plans at no extra cost, including lifetime plans.

faq.question: Where is Internxt based?
answer: Internxt is based in Valencia, Spain, making it a GDPR compliant cloud storage solution that follows strict EU privacy laws.

faq.question: Is Proton Drive more expensive than Internxt?
answer: With your exclusive {{percentage}}% discount, Internxt plans are cheaper than Proton Drive's current pricing. Additionally, Proton Drive only offers up to 500GB for personal use.
You can also avoid recurring subscription costs by choosing an Internxt lifetime plan, an option Proton Drive does not provide.

faq.question: How do I contact support?
answer: You can contact hello@internxt.com and our Customer Success Team will be happy to help. Internxt offers live support, which Proton Drive lacks for basic users.

faq.question: Can I add more storage to my lifetime plan?
answer: Yes, you can upgrade your plan from the settings of your Internxt account, and your storage will be automatically stacked.

faq.question: Can I pay with credit card, PayPal, or cryptocurrency?
answer: Internxt currently accepts debit and credit cards, PayPal, iDEAL, Sofort, Cryptocurrency, and Klarna.
